name: MacRitchie Reservoir
overview: Singapore's oldest and largest reservoir, built in 1867, featuring 12 hectares of lush nature trails and the iconic TreeTop Walk suspension bridge through the Central Catchment Nature Reserve.

transport.mrt: Caldecott Station (Circle/Thomson-East Coast Lines), then 15-minute walk
transport.bus: Buses 52, 74, 93, 132, 157, 165, 166 to Venus Drive or Lornie Road
transport.car: Free parking at Venus Drive carpark and multi-storey carpark (7 AM - 7 PM)

scenic: TreeTop Walk - 250m free-standing suspension bridge at 25m height with canopy views
Jelutong Tower - 7-storey observation tower overlooking the reservoir
hours: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM daily (TreeTop Walk closed on Mondays)

name: Bukit Timah Nature Reserve
overview: Singapore's highest natural point at 163 meters, this 163-hectare ASEAN Heritage Park preserves the largest primary rainforest fragment with 40% of Singapore's flora and fauna species.

transport.mrt: Beauty World or Sixth Avenue Station, then bus or 20-minute walk
transport.car: Limited parking at Hindhede Drive entrance (6 AM - 7 PM)

scenic: Summit Trail - Climb to Singapore's highest peak at 163.63m for achievement satisfaction
Eco-Link@BKE - Southeast Asia's first ecological bridge connecting forests

name: Rail Corridor (Central)
overview: A 4km heritage trail along the former Malayan Railway line, connecting Hillview to Bukit Timah Railway Station through scenic bridges and lush greenery with rustic charm.

transport.mrt: Hillview Station Exit B (wheelchair accessible) or multiple access points
transport.bus: Various routes to Hillview, Bukit Timah, or Dairy Farm areas
transport.car: Parking available at The Rail Mall (charges apply)

scenic: Upper Bukit Timah Truss Bridge - Iconic steel truss bridge with forest views
Bukit Timah Railway Station - Historic 1930s station building and heritage site
hours: Open 24/7 (Not lit at night, leave before dark recommended)

name: Coney Island
overview: An 81-hectare coastal island park with rustic beaches, mangrove boardwalks, and rich wildlife including 80+ bird species, accessible via a scenic promenade walk from Punggol.

transport.mrt: Punggol Station, then Bus 84 to Punggol Road End, walk 500m along promenade
transport.bus: Bus 84 from Punggol MRT to access point
transport.car: Parking at Punggol Settlement, then 10-minute walk to island entrance

scenic: 5 Coastal Beaches (A-E) - Peaceful sandy shores with Johor Strait views
Mangrove Boardwalk - Wooden walkway through coastal mangroves between Beaches B & C
hours: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM daily (Gates close at 7 PM)

name: Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve
overview: A 202-hectare internationally significant wetland sanctuary with 150+ bird species, featuring coastal trails, mangrove boardwalks, and seasonal migratory bird viewing from August to April.

transport.mrt: Kranji Station, then Bus 925 (Mon-Sat) or 925M (Sun/PH) to Kranji Reservoir, 15-min walk
transport.car: Free parking at Visitor Centre (Kranji Way) and Wetland Centre (Neo Tiew Crescent)

scenic: Migratory Bird Trail - 1.95km wheelchair-friendly path for birdwatching at tidal ponds
Coastal Trail Pods - 5 photogenic viewing pods including elevated Kingfisher Pod with Johor views

name: Labrador Nature Reserve
overview: A 22-hectare coastal reserve combining mangrove trails, WWII military heritage sites, and scenic boardwalks with sea views of Keppel Marina and Sentosa Island.

transport.mrt: Labrador Park Station (Circle Line), 10-15 minute walk via Labrador Villa Road
transport.bus: Buses to Labrador Park or Keppel Road areas
transport.car: Free parking at Carparks A, B, C (24 hours, parking fees apply)

scenic: Berlayer Creek Mangrove Trail - 500m wooden boardwalk through coastal mangroves and mudflats
WWII Heritage Trail - Explore Fort Pasir Panjang gun batteries, bunkers, and Dragon's Teeth Gate
hours: Nature Reserve: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM | Park areas: Open 24 hours
